text:
Started out a simple computation using SymPy today and noticed that it took a while. Spent the time I was waiting for SymPy to return to read the docs for Symbolics.jl, reimplemented the same thing using Symbolics and 20 minutes later I had the answer, before SymPy was done. The same computation using Symbolics.jl took
```1.552 ms (10755 allocations: 424.75 KiB)```
(admittedly, after the time-to-first simplify of about 5 seconds :slightly_smiling_face:)
Symbolics.jl may be a bit rough around the edges, but sure looks promising!

Symbolics.jl may be a bit rough around the edges, but sure looks promising!

text: People often argue that in high-level languages, you can sacrifice performance in exchange for programmer productivity, so that it saves total time... No trade-offs are made in Julia. We are just greedy like that. :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: People often argue that in high-level languages, you can sacrifice performance in exchange for programmer productivity, so that it saves total time... No trade-offs are made in Julia. We are just greedy like that.

text: curious what's the task? I'm fairly unfamiliar with both library so just want to know what is slow in SymPy

elements.text: curious what's the task? I'm fairly unfamiliar with both library so just want to know what is slow in SymPy

text: It was a particular form of parallel connection of LTI systems together with a Tustin discretization. I'm not sure exactly what was slow, but it involved the inverse of a 6x6 matrix and a quadratic form of the same size

text: Another thing that we are lacking is symbolic solves, like `solve(sin(x)/a, x)` .

elements.text: Another thing that we are lacking is symbolic solves, like
solve(sin(x)/a, x)

text:
Lots of small missing rules that add up. I find Mathematica's `FullSimplify` just generally more reliable than Symbolics for reducing various expressions.

I alos just generally trust mathematica more to not make an algebraic mistake, though Symbolics is getting more and more reliable, but I can still get nervous about it.
